str2: (a) gen: with, in company with, (b) acc: (1) behind, beyond, after, of place, (2) after, of time, with nouns, neut. of adjectives.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: From ana and strepho; to overturn; also to return; by implication, to busy oneself, i.e. Remain, live.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: From ana and oikodomeo; to rebuild.
David, King of Israel. Of Hebrew origin; Dabid, the Israelite king.

parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Active - Accusative Feminine Singular
str2: A reduplicated and contracted form of peto; probably akin to petomai through the idea of alighting; to fall.
A tent, booth, tabernacle, abode, dwelling, mansion, habitation. Apparently akin to skeuos and skia; a tent or cloth hut.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Feminine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Middle or Passive - Accusative Neuter Plural
str2: To dig down under, demolish, undermine. From kata and skapto; to undermine, i.e. destroy.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: From ana and oikodomeo; to rebuild.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: To make upright (straight) again, rear again, restore. From ana and a derivative of the base of orthos; to straighten up.
